item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Patti Smith
item.description: "For life is the best thing we have in this existence. And if we should desire to believe in something, it should be a beacon within. This beacon being the sun, sea, and sky, our children, our work, our companions and, most simply put, the embodiment of love." -- Patti Smith

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "But I also say this: that light is an invitation to happiness, and that happiness, when it's done right, is a kind of holiness, palpable and redemptive. " -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "You can have the other words-chance, luck, coincidence, serendipity. I'll take grace. I don't know what it is exactly, but I'll take it. " -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I do not understand the mystery of grace -- only that it meets us where we are and does not leave us where it found us." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "...I want first of all - in fact, as an end to these other desires - to be at peace with myself. I want a singleness of eye, a purity of intention, a central cor to my life that will enable me to carry out these obligations and activities as well as I can. I want, in fact - to borrow from the language of the saints -to live 'in grace' as much of the time as possible. I am not using this term in a strictly theological sense. By grace I mean an inner harmony, essentially spiritual, which can be translated into outward harmony..." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I am all the ages I've ever been." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "I believe in kindness. Also in mischief. Also in singing, especially when singing is not necessarily prescribed." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Keep some room in your heart for the unimaginable." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Sometimes I need only to stand wherever I am to be blessed." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "I want to think again of dangerous and noble things. I want to be light and frolicsome. I want to be improbable beautiful and afraid of nothing, as though I had wings." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "I stood willingly and gladly in the characters of everything - other people, trees, clouds. And this is what I learned, that the world's otherness is antidote to confusion - that standing within this otherness - the beauty and the mystery of the world, out in the fields or deep inside books - can re-dignify the worst-stung heart." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"Still, what I want in my life is to be willing to be dazzled— to cast aside the weight of facts
and maybe even to float a little above this difficult world." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Every day I see or hear something that more or less kills me with delight, that leaves me like a needle in the haystack of light." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Jeanne Lohmann
item.description: "In this universe if we’re lucky, we will live in our children’s stories, their tales that will turn us to legend, some absurd truth that has nothing to do with our plans, our meticulous records. No matter what stories we discard or keep, they will give us a life we cannot imagine." -- Jeanne Lohmann

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"to live in this world
you must be able to do three things to love what is mortal; to hold it
against your bones knowing your own life depends on it; and, when the time comes to let it go, to let it go" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Ursula K. Leguin
item.description: "The important thing is not the finding, it is the seeking, it is the devotion with which one spins the wheel of prayer and scripture, discovering the truth little by little. If this machine gave you the truth immediately, you would not recognize it." -- Ursula K. Leguin

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description:
"The book itself is a curious artifact, not showy in its technology but complex and extremely efficient: a really neat little device, compact, often very pleasant to look at and handle, that can last decades, even centuries. It doesn't have to be plugged in, activated, or performed by a machine; all it needs is light, a human eye, and a human mind. It is not one of a kind, and it is not ephemeral. It lasts. It is reliable. If a book told you something when you were fifteen, it will tell it to you again when you're fifty, though you may understand it so differently that it seems you're reading a whole new book."
(<i>Staying Awake: Notes on the alleged decline of reading</i>, Harper's Magazine, February 2008)" -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Libraries really are wonderful. They're better than bookshops, even. I mean bookshops make a profit on selling you books, but libraries just sit there lending you books quietly out of the goodness of their hearts." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "When you light a candle, you also cast a shadow." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Books, for me, are a home. Books don’t make a home – they are one, in the sense that just as you do with a door, you open a book, and you go inside. Inside there is a different kind of time and a different kind of space." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Joy Harjo
item.description: "To pray you open your whole self To sky, to earth, to sun, to moon To one whole voice that is you And know there is more That you can't see, can't hear Can't know except in moments Steadly growing, and in languages That aren't always sound but other Circles of motion. Like eagle that Sunday morning Over Salt River. Circled in blue sky In wind, swept our hearts clean With sacred wings. We see you, see ourselves and know That we must take the utmost care And kindness in all things. Breathe in, knowing we are made of All this, and breathe, knowing We are truly blessed because we Were born, and die soon within a True circle of motion, Like eagle rounding out the morning Inside us. We pray that it will be done In beauty. In beauty." -- Joy Harjo

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "When someone doesn't show up, the people who wait sometimes tell stories about what might have happened and come to half believe the desertion, the abduction, the accident. Worry is a way to pretend that you have knowledge or control over what you don't--and it surprises me, even in myself, how much we prefer ugly scenarios to the pure unknown. Perhaps fantasy is what you fill up maps with rather than saying that they too contain the unknown." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Kivrin add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "How do you calculate upon the unforeseen? It seems to be an art of recognizing the role of the unforeseen, of keeping your balance amid surprises, of collaborating with chance, of recognizing that there are some essential mysteries in the world and thereby a limit to calculation, to plan, to control." -- Rebecca Solnit
